title: RUST-735 Remove Document as default generic type on Collection and Cursor
body:
RUST-735

This PR removes `Document` as the default generic type for `Collection` and `Cursor` and updates `Database::collection` and `Database::collection_with_options` to return `Collection<T>`. As part of this, the existing typed helpers became redundant and were removed. These changes were made to ease and promote the use of serde models with the driver instead of regular Documents.

Note: I didn't update the README examples to avoid confusing users of the 1.2.x or 2.0.0-alpha versions. I filed RUST-736 to cover the work for updating that, which we can do right before the release.

title: RUST-724 Include versioned API options in the public API
body:
RUST-724

This updates the `versioned-api` branch to include the versioned API options in the public API for private beta users to use. We'll need to do this on the master branch in the future, so I filed RUST-732 to track that.

title: minor: only include master branch's MSRV in README
body:
This PR removes past version MSRV information from the master branch README. Note that since we tag all our major and minor releases on the master branch, the README used by crates.io for a given release will continue to display the correct MSRV for that version, even if master has moved forwards afterwards.

Including only a single version will help reduce the proliferation of stale MSRV information for different releases (e.g. the [requirements section in the 2.0.0-alpha release](https://crates.io/crates/mongodb/2.0.0-alpha) has outdated MSRV information for the master branch).  Subsequent patch releases on the version branch then only have to update the MSRV in that branch's README, rather than having to update it in master / other release branches as well. 

Note that the MSRV for the given version may still become out of date if it gets bumped retroactively (e.g. like in #320 ), but we can document that possibility in RUST-730.

This is the model used by [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/tree/v0.2.x#supported-rust-versions).

title: minor: bump MSRV to 1.46 (1.2.x)
body: A transitive dependency of async-std bumped their MSRV to 1.46, so we must do so too. This PR also updates the README for the 1.2.x branch to only reflect the MSRV of the 1.2.x driver. This should help reduce any stale information across READMEs. I'll file a similar PR to update the master branch to only include the latest released version and the master requirement.

title: RUST-728 Inherit collection options in find and count_documents (1.2.x)
RUST-714 Fix possible deadlock during retry
body: This PR adds a test to ensure deadlock doesn't occur during a retry when all connections are checked out from the pool. This was possible in the released 2.0.0-alpha, but was incidentally fixed in a subsequent PR.

title: RUST-714 Fix possible deadlock during retry (1.x driver)
body:
RUST-714

This backports a fix for a potential deadlock that can occur during a retry when all connections are checked out from the pool.

title: RUST-649 Document versioned API usage with examples
body: RUST-649

title: RUST-720 Use Timestamp's Ord implementation for ClusterTime
RUST-604 Use mongodb::Client for unified runner entities
body:
RUST-604

This PR updates the unified runner to use regular `mongodb::Client` for the client entities instead of `EventClient` / `TestClient`, which allows us to unconditionally use `buildInfo` and drop the `collect_server_info` option in `TestClient`.

title: RUST-728 Inherit collection options in find and count_documents
RUST-655 / RUST-691 Simplification of SDAM error handling
body:
RUST-655 / RUST-691

This PR updates and simplifies how errors are handled by the SDAM machinery based on the specification updates in DRIVERS-1152 and DRIVERS-1476. These two tickets were closely related so I opted to include them in the same PR. I was sort of working on both of them at the same time, so it was hard to go back at the end and separate them into logical commits; sorry if this makes reviewing more difficult.

Notable changes:
- consolidation of all application error handling to single `handle_application_error` method (RUST-691)
- updated the SDAM spec test runner to support the new errors tests (both)
- only error codes are inspected for SDAM purposes (RUST-655)

title: RUST-658 Change estimatedDocumentCount() to use the $collStats agg stage
body: To implement this feature, I augmented the `Count` operation so that it sends an `aggregation` command instead of a `count` command on server versions new enough to support $collStats. However, this required being able to deserialize either type of command response in `Operation::handle_response`. The cleanest way to do this seemed to be to pass in the StreamDescription to `handle_response` in the same way it's done in `build` (which is trivial to do from the execution layer), so I updated the Operation trait to include that in the signature. This required a large number of changes elsewhere in the driver, but it won't require any additional changes moving forward, so I think it's worth it.

title: Sync CRUD spec tests and fix failures
body: When I sync'd the CRUD spec tests as part of RUST-658, there were a few failures in the CRUD v2 tests due to various bugs. Since they were all small and easy to fix, I filed tickets where needed and compiled the fixes into a single PR (with a separate commit per fix to make reviewing easier). If any changes need to be made as part of review, I'll commit them as separate commits, and then once everything is approved I'll rebase locally to squash each commit from review with the associated commit of the fix it's related to, and then I'll use the "rebase and merge" option to ensure that each fix gets merged as a separate commit.

title: RUST-707 Swap from time::PreciseTime to std::time::Instant
RUST-52 Implement Sessions API
RUST-705 replace err-derive with thiserror
RUST-696: update all dependencies that don't have breaking changes
RUST-679 Simplify error API to ease pattern matching
body: There were several different places in the driver that we assumed we could clone errors, so I handled each of those places (along with cascading changes due to other places related to that code) in a separate commit to make it easier to follow along with each one. The final commit removes the Arc and the Clone derive from the Error type. Because of this, I think the easier way to review this PR is to review each commit separately so that all of the different unrelated changes don't make things confusing. I'll push a separate commit for each change that's suggested during review, and then once everything looks okay, I'll rebase to move each change into the commit associated with the part that changed and request one final review to make sure that all of the changes look okay after that rebase.

body: These arrays aren't modified in run time, so there's no reason for them to be vectors.

title: RUST-675 eliminate race in server selection
body:
RUST-675

This PR eliminates a race in server selection between a task subscribing to topology updates and the update actually occurring. Right now, a client only subscribes to server selection updates after it fails to select a server, so if the topology becomes selectable while a server selection attempt is in progress but before it fails, the client will never know about the update since it will only have started listening for it after the update already happened, leading to a server selection timeout. This PR updates the server selection loop to subscribe to topology updates _before_ it attempts to select a server, preventing this error from occurring.

When running this library on alpine I received the error

```
os_info::imp::lsb_release lsb_release command failed with Os {

}
```
I think this has been fixed in a later version of os_info

title: Remove unused dependencies: futures-intrusive

labels.name: tracked-in-jira
labels.description: Ticket filed in Mongo's Jira system

body: [RUSTSEC-2020-0072](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0072) valid for `futures-intrusive <0.4.0`, but since `futures-intrusive` is not used in crate this dependency can be removed.

title: RUST-590 Allow pool to be paused
body:
RUST-590

This PR updates the connection pool to support the "pausing" feature introduced in https://github.com/mongodb/specifications/pull/878 (SPEC-1530 / SPEC-1242). This allows the pool to halt operations (i.e. return errors from `check_out`, stop populating minPoolSize) when the endpoint it is associated with goes down and also before it is discovered to be in a known state. This also allows the pool to fully clear its WaitQueue when the pool is cleared. 

This is the last PR as part of Avoiding Connection Storms (DRIVERS-781)

title: RUST-617 Add BSON benchmarks
body: It looks like in my previous rebase and merge, I accidentally left off the changes to using the runtime-specific I/O APIs, so I included it here as a separate commit from the BSON work (and tagged separately with the ticket number for the previous PR as well).

title: minor: fix formatting
RUST-613 Upgrade typed-builder to 0.4.0
body: This PR upgrades the `typed-builder` dependency to version 0.4.0. The latest `typed-builder` version is 0.8.0, but upgrading to this version entails breaking changes for users, so we will hold off on this upgrade until we reach 2.0.

title: RUST-609 Fix flaky maxConnecting test
body:
RUST-609

This PR pulls in the latest version of the "maxConnecting is enforced" spec test, hopefully fixing some intermittent failures we were seeing with it. In order to run the new version of the test, I had to update our CMAP test operations to be dispatched in order that they are listed in the file (see the first commit). This latter change fixes RUST-608.

This PR is part of the "Avoiding Connection Storms" work (DRIVERS-781).

title: RUST-610 Test that monitors wait at least minHeartbeatFrequencyMS between failed checks
body:
RUST-610

This PR implements a new SDAM spec prose test that ensures the monitors wait at least 500ms between failed checks. This is part of the Avoiding Connection Storms project (DRIVERS-781).

relevant spec change: https://github.com/mongodb/specifications/commit/6c5b2acbf5a30b2c79e904532d51ba9ed8783247

title: RUST-611 Port benchmarking suite from `unreviewed-impl` to current state of driver
body: As part of the initial work to get benchmarks in evergreen, I updated the benchmarking suite from the `unreviewed-impl` branch to account for the API changes since it was written (which are mostly due to changing the driver to be async). I made a commit that dropped in the benchmarks as-is and then a subsequent one with my changes both to give @benjirewis credit for his work and to make the review process for the changes easier.

title: RUST-598 Perform handshake when establishing monitoring connections
body:
RUST-598

This fixes a bug where monitoring connections didn't perform the MongoDB handshake as part of establishing their connections. I decided to break this off from the other connection storms work since it seemed to be ready and the other stuff is still waiting on spec changes.

title: minor: suggest workarounds for rustc 1.46+ regression
body: This PR adds a note to the README informing users of some workarounds for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/75992, which is often encountered when using the driver in combination with actix-web.

title: minor: fix lints for rust 1.48
body: Rust 1.48 came out today, and as usual there are a host of new lints

title: RUST-575 Consider connection pool health during server selection
body:
RUST-575

This PR updates server selection to consider the number of ongoing operations a each server has instead of randomly selecting from among those in the latency window. This done as part of DRIVERS-781 Avoiding Connection Storms. See https://github.com/mongodb/specifications/commit/07790d1978ebe6b8ff7f574c9ac5e1365dd16e26 for the spec changes.

This also fixes RUST-592.

title: RUST-577 Versioned API implementation
RUST-485 Unified test runner
body: This PR implements the unified test runner.

body: The BSON crate offered the "unsigned integer to integer (u2i)" auto conversion feature. Since the crate is now reexported, it would be nice to still be able to use this.
